text: They're good.  The food is good.  Lots of flavor.  Across from their old location. The meat and chicken are delicious! Love! totally recommend! The green hot sauce so Bueno and the prices are great!

This restaurants customer service needs alot of work. The young man Kevin that takes carry out orders has alot to learn about good customer service and problem resolution. The food is good at a great price if you can get the correct food. I truly hope the owner's see the customer service criticisms as a chance to improve and not continue to let the horrible service be the ongoing trend it has been.

We have been going to brasa Rojas for quite some time and there aren't too many "al carbon" restaurants that live up to this place .we always get the chicken special with beans , rice and salad  for just $5.95 i always judge a place by its beans , and these are great ! The chicken is seasoned well and charred JUST right .  HIGHLY recommend it

La Brasa Roja is one of my favorite restaurants to get a quick eats. They do offer lots of seating if you choose to dine in as well. Parking is not available so be prepared to pay the meter. I've only had the 1/4 chicken special from here and it's always cooked to perfection. The rotisserie chicken is full of flavor and so juicy, it will keep you coming back. The dish is complimented by white rice & beans and a side salad. The side salad is like nothing I've ever had before. It's a mixture of shredded lettuce, cabbage, and white onion. It tastes well when mixing with the  rice and beans. I usually get the Postobon, a manzana (apple) flavored soda. It has a unique taste that makes the entire meal completely satisfying.  This Colombian cuisine offers a wide range of authentic dishes. If your looking to have a finger licking meal definitely give them a try. They are inexpensive and offer fast service.

great cheap eats. lots on the menu. if you ask for private seating they can put you in the bathroom which is fine, but no view. there was an endless napkin roll next to my seat. very convenient! seat was a little cold, but the food came hot. difficult to fit more than 1 in booth, but lack of a table top made it easier. my date loved the hogs leg, which she devoured hands free! i ate the red snapper. highly recommend this place!
Nice little place in Albany Park. Simple fare but very flavorful. We had one of the steak dishes. Reasonable prices too!

The most authentic Colombian food I've ever had, if I could give more stars I would. So good, humble and traditional. Service is one of a kind and the food choices to match, great pricing for the quantity and quality of food. Nothing beats the empanadas! I found this chicago gem with yelp and I'm forever thankful. They have a classic lunch stable special for only $6 you get steak, rice, beans and salad. You can never go wrong with brass roja. Try everything!
The food was delicious... The chicken and the meat cooked to the perfection and the potatoes a nice touch... BUT the service was very poor... I will back but to only order to go...

Picked up some carry-out. Service was friendly and efficient. I was directed by the grill master up front to place my order with a server in the back. Ordered steak (a perfect med-rare), a whole chicken and a 1/2 rabbit. It was a feast for 4 adults and 2 hungry children. Lots of leftovers too. Good job Brasa Roja!!!

Great food for a good price. We had the lunch specials for $5.95 each- a carne asada and rotisserie chicken. Plus I got a coffee & my bf got fries - fries weren't that great in my opinion since I tasted more oil , but I should've salted it before it entered my mouth. My bf was there once before - the same week we went - and we would go again still. It was packed by the time we got there on a Saturday early afternoon, but some tables were cleared about 1/2 hour later.

I love this place! I usually go to the one on Addison and Pulaski but they take FOREVER to bring our food and I hate ordering appetizers and my food alright after. But this location is way nicer and the server was very polite. Easy/quick seating and everything was delicious, as always of course.
This place has decent food but the service isn't the best. If you are there just for the food and willing to wave waiters down then it's your place!

Love that this is in my neighborhood. Quality and delicious at a great price. As a half Panamanian who has a ton of Columbia friends, I'd say this place is legit. They raised their prices a bit since they moved but they're still worth it. We eat here all the time.

This is the best chicken in Chicago, period. They roast it on a rotisserie with charcoal. It's quick, inexpensive, and authentic. Service is great. You can tell they get good support from the neighborhood patrons.
Food and service is consistently amazing.  Favorite lunch spot. Chicken has never disappointed in 2 years. Go here immediately.

Would have gave this place a full five stars but they are kind of expensive, some dishes are affordable but most are a little pricey just check the menu and you'll see what I mean. Other than that it's a great place if you got the money. The food is incredible, one of the best Columbian restaurants I've been to and I've been to alot of Colombian restaurants in Chicago and this place is by far one of the best spots in town. Food is delicious! I love their bistec encebollado it's soo tasty. I've tried only 4 other dishes and their pizza as well but I'm sure all of the dishes are just as great.

I have been to Brasa Roja before and liked it. I just ordered it from Postmates... the food delivered was NOT anything I remembered when I dined there. The chicken was flavorful but too dry and too much garlic (even though yes I ordered the garlic chicken). I ordered a side of sweet plantains. FYI in order for plantains to taste sweet they must be ripe. They clearly didn't use a ripe enough plantain. The rice was decent what I expected. The empanadas were ok as well... mine was delivered cold but I don't blame that on the restaurant. Not very satisfied :(

Food: I've had nothing but the same dish - the chicken breast with garlic. Very tasty, with rice, potatoes and plantains. Very juicy too. Never had a plate like this since eating at Assemheims 56 in London, but that's a different thing altogether. BR made this dish in about 10 minutes or less but was tasty and reliable every time. I usually stop at BR and eat it at Templestowe Pub when it didn't offer food, but now they do but don't mind you bringing it in. Service: I wouldn't call this place the most friendly of all places but have good decent people who will help you and serve you. I got my order and was satisfied and very well wrapped up to go, while my buddy wanted tacos but one of the gents here suggested to another place for tacos. Good peoples here. Misc: These folks moved across the street from the Montrose Avenue south side of the block to the Northside almost directly across the street. Neither places have awesome decor, but it was functional and did the job, and wasn't dirty either. A bit cozy and a bit divey. Good, solid South American food, and will return for more!

Looking for a place open late on a rainy Monday night, Brasa Roja was bright and welcoming.  Inside there was a carryout counter with the rotisserie set up behind it. Further back was a large dining area with many tables, some large and small. The walls and ceiling were bright and colorful with intricate murals. There were a few occupied tables, and the waiter in the back motioned us to a table towards the back. There were some large family groups dining in, so they can easily accommodate a larger group.  The food was very good, humble and traditional, hearty fare. You won't leave hungry.  We had the churrasco, chicken soup, Colombian tamale (huge), and empanadas. All were delicious and homemade. The tamale was one of the largest i've had, it was the size of a brick. Unique and delicious flavor, with plenty of pork. Bone and skin included, fyi. The soup also had some interesting cuts, like neck, liver, and hearts. The steak was huge also, and served on a sizzling metal platter.  Service was quick and very friendly, he made some suggestions which we appreciated.  I'll return to try the chicken, also the lamb and rabbit dishes which sounded pretty exotic.
Super affordable, byo, great chicken, great rotisserie rabbit, surprisingly good whole garlic snapper. A real neighborhood gem.

I used to love this place and would always come here often with family, friends or just for dinner with my husband. I went into today and the people where just completely rude. I was getting take out and was waiting to order. To the side of me there where 4-5 employees just sitting down on some on their phones others just talking. They knew I had been there for some time waiting for someone to take my order. One of the waiters was just staring at me and I asked if there was someone who would take my order for take out. She just said ok and looked away. Another customer walks in and the the waiter walks up and takes her order. One of the other gentlemen told her i was there first and have been waiting for a while and that they should take my order first. She told him no it's ok she can wait. I couldn't believe it. It was a long day and I didn't want to argue but never have I seen such a rude staff before. I used to come here very often and it was one of my go to places. The rude staff makes it a bad experience to come here. Wouldn't recommend it.

Love this place; however, one of the waiters is so rude. Yes, I'm talking about the gay dude that works here. I really don't understand what his problem is but he's always in a bitchy mood. His attitude is ruining this place.  Even one of my friends told me about him that's why every time I come here I avoid sitting on his area or request another waiter. Other than that this place rocks.  P.S. This review is meant to be for him not the place.

I went here for lunch with a coworker. We both ordered the half chicken but didn't want the potato or the corn that comes with the $8.95 meal. We both got the plantains, but they were he'd and tasted like they were cooking multiple times. I brought this to the attention of the waiter and he didn't offer to take any charge off of the bill. We also both ordered rice and beans. They charged $2.50 for just the rice and $2.50 for the beans. The waiter refused to substitute the corn and potato for the rice and beans. The horrible plantains the fact that the waiter knew about the issue with the plantains and wouldn't rectify the issue, is why I have this place one star. My coworker and I are knocking this place off of our list of places to eat!

They have cheap specials -$5.95 for chicken or steak- which comes with rice, beans and greens. Make sure to ask about it since it's not on the menu (they have signs on the windows). My steak special was tasty. The empanadas were great as well!
Love this place! It's not a fancy place but the food is great! It's byob as well which is a plus. Best Colombian restaurant I've tried here in Chicago so far.

I absolutely love this place! I come here all the time.  Great food at an unbeatable price! My favorites are the quarter chicken meal and the ribeye meal selling for $5 (plus tax). It's good quality food, nicely prepared, and very yummy.  The people working here seem very friendly, however, I've never eaten in, I only have done take out. It should be noted that all the menus I've seen were just in Spanish and I'm not sure if they have English versions around.

Food is delicious and plenty.especially the churrasco and roast chicken,. service is the worst I ever seen; always crowded ,the manager always had an attitude and if your not light skin gets worst . Waiters always forget something ,and overworked,the reason I always come back is the food..if you looking for good food for the buck this is your place....that's why I give 3 stars

The food here is really good.  The chicken and steak combo meal gives you a ton of meat and the portions are pretty big.  I think they might have recently raised some prices because it seems a little more expensive than I remember, but overall the quality is great and the price is decent. I've aways had an issue with the service at this restaurant.  You  really have no idea what to do when you get inside and no one really goes up to you.  You just sort of figure you have to sit down and someone will come to you.  If the service was better, I would give it a 5.

absolutly love colombian food its the best! everytime we go north we stop by its best! wish my town had a colombian restaurant!   glad i found this restuarant. i highly recommend it!  tasty food love it.

After an amazing trip to Colombia, I was in the mood for some Colombian cuisine. I immediately went to Yelp to see what Helpers recommended aside from the normal "Las Tablas". A quick browse showed Brasa Roja as the top spot! After reading the reviews, and looking at the numerous pictures I figured this would be the perfect place to visit.  Upon walking in I immediately took in all of the delicious smells and did a quick scan of the restaurant. The restaurant was crowded, and cumbia could be heard playing over the speakers. Right as you enter, there's a giant grill with pollo asado (grilled chicken) constantly going. I was so distracted by the chicken that I pretty much forgot why I was there. As I stood there, a waiter came by and asked whether I wanted to eat there or take the food to go. After saying I wanted to stay, he pointed to a table and told me that I could seat myself. Once seated the waiter brought over the menu (there are 2. The red menu is in Spanish, and the black menu is in English). I came in with the intention of ordering everything that sounded remotely tasty, and I just about did it haha The food: I started off with 2 empanadas(meat filled pastries) and an Arepa con queso (like a corn pancake filled with cheese). To drink I had a Jugo de Maracuya(Passion fruit smoothie). When you order this drink, you have the choice of having them make it with water or milk. For the main course I ordered the Bandeja Paisa (traditional dish from Medellin, Colombia.. Pictures to come later).  Within 5 minutes, the appetizers were out, and they looked amazing. The empanadas were filled with just enough meat and potato, and the arepa was just the right temperature, and the cheese wasn't overwhelming. The passion fruit smoothie added just the right touch! Not too long after, the main dish arrived, and man was I surprised. The bandeja paisa is my "go-to" dish when I order Colombian food, but this one looked like it had taken a year's supply of steroids. There was so much food I literally had no idea where to start. As I sat there literally like a deer in headlights, I figured I would make life easier and just eat everything at the same time. My taste buds literally went crazy!! Every single thing was delicious! From the rice, to the steak, to the pork. I'm usually the kind of person to finish everything on their plate, but this time I couldn't even get through half of it and that says a lot!!  The service: As I mentioned before, the place was packed and people we're constantly coming in. The staff did a good job of getting folks seated and taking orders. After that, it pretty much seemed like folks were on their own haha. I observed a few other tables and noticed that they had to keep reminding their servers to bring things (napkins, drinks, etc). Even at my table, the waiter never came back to check on us or to refill the water. In the beginning I understood since it was pretty busy, but it seemed to be a trend throughout the whole place.  Overall Brass Roja gets good recommendations from me! The food is good and plentiful, and you don't have to wait forever for it to come. (I actually ordered more food to go haha). I can't really complain about the service although it could be a little better, but since the food was good I'll just ignore it haha.

Love this place!!! I get the steak or chicken special! You get rice, Steak, beans and a little side salad for like 6 bucks! Food is great and the places decorations are so cute. I love this place I visit every week and never was disappointed!
Low key, simple, and delicious.  No pretense here, just good food. The chicken is moist and full of flavor!

Never disappointed. Moved across the street to a bigger location with beautiful murals of an indoor town. Winderful service, food, and might I add that it makes a big difference when the proprietor is at your table making you laugh and inquiring about your day. Adds that 1 to make it a 5.

OMG I love this place.  Another excellent Yelp find.  I was in the area and true to form looking for someplace new and exciting.  I saw the pictures and most of the food looked remarkable.   The first thing you see when you walk in are the rotisserie chickens cooking.  The aroma is heavenly.  I ordered the lunch special with 1/4 rotisserie chicken, beans, rice and salad with cabbage.  The beans and rice were both delicious instead of a plate of bland tasteless sides they were scrumptious and I enjoyed ever morsel to of both sides.  The salad was sliced lettuce with sliced cabbage nothing special, but the crunch of the cabbage gave it a nice texture then you add the green salsa for salad dressing and you have a yummy salad. Would I go back again you betcha.  In fact I'm probably going to dreaming about Brasa Roja rotisserie chicken tonight.
Great Colombian food especially the lunch special. Great price with good amount of food. Will leave here satisfied.

It wasn't planning on coming here, but the public restrooms at Homer Park weren't open and I had to figure out an alternative plan before my bladder gave in.   I guess Rosa J. had some kind of foodie instinct, even during the period of urgency.  I couldn't particularly pin-point where "Brasa Roja" was, but I knew I was nearby.   Ok, now my "necessary" crisis has been averted, it's time to talk about the food.  "Brasa Roja" is both dine-in and take-out friendly.  Apparently this Montrose location is fairly new; they literally moved from the corner across street.  According to some of the Yelp reviews I read, the price of "pollo entero" went up $4 since the relocation.  For $13.95, this is still good to serve two (2) people.  The entire entree comes with baked potatoes and plantains.   The chicken was very, very flavorful.  I knew I've had rotisserie chicken elsewhere that was cheaper in the city, yet I am confident to say that the taste and their salsa verde were more superior than these places I visited.   They do have a satellite location on Pulaski and Addison, which is more convenient for me if I ever want to place an order to-go.
The service, food and ambience make this a dining experience.  You will not be disappointed with the authentic meals without breaking your bank account.  Will return in the very near future.

The best chicken in the block! Service is fast, but phone orders are even faster. I had gotten used to a specific price, but then they raised it not too long ago. Regardless, it is still tasty, accomodating and well-worth it!
OMG! Amazing food. Los empandas are amazing. The chicken cook is out infront and you can see him prepare your meat.

I'm willing to try anything once or twice. But with this restaurant I'm willing to eat it EVERYDAY. And the fact that it's within walking distance of my home is even better. I love the fact that I can walk in to this place see the chickens rotating in the charcoal oven. Add a side of beans and rice with fried plantains and you're ready for a good time. And the homemade salsa is a must. And if you manage to not finish it all, don't worry. It even tastes good if you have to reheat it in the oven or microwave. But I seem to never have any left to reheat ;) This is definitely one of my top places to go for affordable and delicious food in Chicago!!!!!
Picked up an order of chicken with sides and arepas. Cheese arepas were delicious and chicken too. I really liked the green salsa that comes with.

I feel like the food used to better in the old restaurant across the street. It is a lot busier now and maybe that's why the food wet down in quality?  It's still a good place to go for a nice churassco or rotisserie chicken.  I ordered the carne asada and it came over cooked, dry and salty. Not the best I have had from here. Probably the worse. My wife also had the rotisserie chicken and she said the chicken didn't taste right either. Maybe it will take some time to get the food back up to par in the new restaurant.  The empanadas are still really good with the salsa they bring out!

You guys, this place is as good as it gets. I'm not Colombian but have been there and have lot's of Colombian's in my life to know what is good Colombian. What I love the most is that they don't mess around. They know their are mostly Mexicans in the neighborhood, (and like most Colombians), know how to run a business and make sure you get your salsa verde and if you ask for tortillas...no problem. :) I had an empanada and chicken lunch special. BOOOMB. I had to go with the chicken, I mean c'mon, for pete's sake, they're slowly rotisserie cooking it right in front of view. It was de-li-cioso!  The place is super chill and down to earth. Looking for just some straight up Colombian home cooking with no bells n whistles...here's the spot.  Oh and they have rabbit! I am going to try that next. I am hoping they braise it or something cause that's a strong meat to mess with.  Oh and ... lunch is SUPER cheap. Just ask for the special during hours, your spending like 6 bucks.
The food here is great i went to get a half chicken meal and loved the chicken. Some of the best chicken ive ever had in my life. Must give it a try. I will sure be back again. Good food mmmmmm.

Does anyone know where they moved to? They are shutdown at this location as of a couple weeks ago. Our family makes a point to go at least once when visiting from out of town. The chicken is delicious!

The restaurant is great very clean you can see the food right in front of you the waitstaff is been the same since the old place across the street absolutely recommend it best chicken and also really great Brad it's gray Columbian cuisine
A must try, charcoal grilled chicken is quite the treat. The rice and beans are tasty. It's been almost  10 yrs since I was last there, but they haven't lost their touch. I'll be back soon!
Amazing whole chicken meal for about $10. Delicious. Before I tried it, I never knew chicken was allowed to taste this juicy and tasty. GO NOW.
Ms Philippines really won but all that aside I keep the chicken, steak, and empanadas from here in rotation like a Michellin tire.

This place rocks my world!!! Yummy chicken at an incredibly low price is so hard to find nowadays...enter La Brasa...my kids get their mango licuados from this place (although we ask with little sugar otherwise its a tad on the sweet side and then they wont sleep)  So..I know this place is not fancy by any means but personally as long as its clean and the service is good, I could care less if the menus are old..the ceiling needs work etc..sometimes you pay more because of the location or the chef that went to Le Cordon Bleu..here its a no frills good old family owned restaurant.  Their empanadas are very good and I especially cant resist their stew (sancocho) made only on Sundays. Minus one star because sometimes their chicken is a bit on the salty side... But I can always count on La Brasa to feed my family and I at an affordable price which again Im finding it harder to do in Chi-town.

Great food! You will receive a traditionally Colombian cooked meal. Since most things are charcoal grilled..the taste is amazing, not to mention you receive oodles of food for your $$ For those that mentioned the meat being dry..it's not! You combine the "chimichurri" sauce with the juicy chicken or steak and it's divine  Service is great and instead of this place looking high end, the money is clearly invested in the food. Although, I can really appreciate the hand painted walls which takes you away to the scenery in Colombia  My recommendation for first timers that have never experienced Colombian food, you're in for a treat: try the Empanadas for your appetizer (1-2 per person, depending on hunger), Matrimonio or the Bandeja Paisa for your entree, and the Colombiana soda to drink. The rotisserie chicken is also excellent! even to go, it's awesome to slam at home like a King or Queen

One of the best meal deals around. You would never assume that this little Albany Park storefront can give you so much bang for your buck (see...chicken...haha). For $6 (the price recently went up. It used to be $5), you get a thin rib eye steak or a 1/4 chicken, the most amazing tasty rice, beans, and an nondescript salad.  Most of the time, I have gotten carryout, but when my husband's family is in town, we eat in. Yes, the place needs a bit of TLC, but the food is extremely tasty. They do seem to have issues pacing meals and getting all of the food out at once. For example, they served everyone who was having steak, but not the chicken entrees until a few minutes later. Also, it took them longer to serve my plantain with guava and cheese.  It is also popular with people of Columbian descent. We noticed many families there who were ordering dishes of their homeland. This shows that it is a quality place.

The rotisserie chicken is super tasty. Get the whole chicken meal with potatoes, corn pancake and plantain. It's cheap and easily feeds two. Do it like a local - walk to the back to order and pay, then wait in line and take it to go.

I got a recommendation from a Colombian girl, to try this restaurant for their national cuisine. 6.15 p.m. Saturday. I come in, have myself seated and wait to be served. The first impression was very good, staff is VERY friendly. Cozy atmosphere, cheerful Latin music is playing, people keep coming in, some for take out, some to dine in. It's not too loud. I'm looking at that awesome Rotisserie grill and can't wait to get my teeth into their chicken.I get the menu and realize, it's only two pages, all items printed in big font with big white space between, so yes.. my choices are quite limited. That's fine with me. I ask my waitress about the specials, and, to my surprise, she only mentions the beef ribs.. "Okay", I think to myself,  go ahead and order the ribs and the Rotisserie chicken. As I'm heading towards the bathroom, I notice signs of "run-downess".. It's not too bad, but it's bad enough for you to make a note of it. I'm coming back, just had my order served and ready to enjoy it! The ribs were.. okay. Overly charred and kinda dry. So was the chicken.. dry..  I've taken time to read other people's reviews, some claim it was the best rotisserie chicken they had tried. To me, it was a very mediocre rotisserie chicken. In the end, I received a check for $27 just for the two dishes and bottle of Malta, a Colombian pop. I think more fair price would've been $20-$22. That was the last nail in the coffin. Again, my kudos to a VERY friendly staff there and I loved the atmosphere, but... On my way out, I got a couple of bunuelos, $1 e.a. Kinda liked them, they taste almost like Russian donuts.  Making a small talk with the grill man while being served, he says - I like your ..., what do you call this.. (points at my wallet) - The wallet? Do you like my wallet? - Yes, yes, I like.  And then he proceeds, "How much?".  That was kinda funny :)
I've eaten from La Brasa hundreds of times.  The food is  thebomb.com

Sorry to agree with other reviews but yes, this place is on the downslide. Today's lunch special of a 1/4 chicken included less then a half of a piece of chicken breast and a dried wing. Came back again after experiencing the same thing my previous visit. Thought it might have been a bad day. Needless to say 2 times in a row is my limit.  Will go elsewhere from now on. Disappointed.

I went there last night with my wife and another couple. I must say the food and the service was great. Not busy at all on a Friday night. I would definitely recommend this for their chicken. Very affordable also
Great chicken I always order to go. They do an amazing job with seasoning and getting that great char on the whole chicken

I don't know what is lately going on with this restaurant but it keeps going downhill for me. :(  The broiled chicken is extremely dried, over cooked and sometimes I get chunks of dried extra hard meat. Why?  The plantain is never soft, always hard and dried. Maybe that's the way they eat it in in Colombia and I'm not aware of this? :/  I have tried plantains or maduros from other places like Fina Estampa or D'Candela and boy are they good! Then again Fina estampa and D'Candela are Peruvian restaurants.  The only thing I do enjoy is the 2 small boiled potatoes that comes when you order a whole broiled chicken.
Easily the best chicken In chicago. Everything is on point and the steady soundtrack of Cumbia really adds to the atmosphere
All their food is good but I just love their rotisserie chicken as a carry out item. Everytime I pick one (or two) up it is super moist and flavorful!

Food is hot and so is this restaurant!  The chicken is roasted in the same room as where you are seated. It may have been 80-85 degrees in there.  The air was on, but not working properly as evidenced by the very leaky air conditioner units. Food was hot & fresh.  I would have preferred more seasonings in everything.  A little bland.  I got the $6 chicken lunch special.

Best chicken in the city. Period. Get the empanadas too. Their steak is also amazing. You can order a steak or chicken special, it comes with rice salad and beans and it's only $6. So not only is it amazing, it's cheap. A whole chicken is $10. Go here. You won't be disappointed.

TIP:    DON'T get the $6 lunch special, order the 1/2 rotisserie chicken for only .95 cents more!!  What a dope I am, I shoulda, woulda, coulda, but didn't doa, when it came to ordering the 1/2 rotisserie chicken with potato, corn pancake and plantain for $6.95, at this location today.   Instead, I ordered the measly lunch special for $6, which was 1/4 of a drumstick and a 1/4 of a thigh (I swear it was smaller), that came with chewy and delicious rice, a whole boatload of beans and a small nondescript salad, I ordered a corn pancake separately, for an extra $2.    Although most of the meal was tasty, I would've been better off if I got more of the chicken, because it was the stuff dreams are made of, succulent, crispy and mouth-watering.  It was that great.  Corn pancake though was a little leaden, but maybe it's suppose to be like that, I don't know??  If somebody could let me know on that one, I'd appreciate it. But if only I ordered the 1/2 chicken, but because I was in such a hurry and so hungry, at that point I could've eaten the wooden tables, and for some reason didn't even bother reading the menu, just went by what I remembered from the Yelp reviews.  Okay here's the reason, it was hot and muggy,plus I couldn't find the Citibank I was looking for and the parking around there is atrocious! Next time I'll definitely get the 1/2 rotisserie chicken and be a little more patient. Honorable mention:  get the flavorful Columbian soda, orange.  Waitress was helpful though, considering there was a little bit of a language barrier.

I usually order for pick up, chicken special with an empanada and an arepa. Taste is great and the price is very affordable. The few times I have dined there the service is really good, fast and efficient.  I recommend getting a "Colombiana" a Colombian soda, ask for a cup with some ice to enhance the flavor. "Buen provecho"
Great rotisserie chicken  I also loved the yuca and plantains I did a take out lots of people
Delicious food. Rotisserie chicken is succulent, flavorful with perfect texture. Good tostones.
Love, love, LOVE the Empanadas! Gave only 4 stars because they've messed up my order more than once.   Try the steak and chicken combo! Its AMAZING!
Best chicken ever and friendly service! Byob and worth every penny. I live right next to it and go there every chance I get. Enjoy!

Dear Potential La Brasa Roja Carry-Out Patron, Would you like some delicious and quick rotisserie chicken to carry across the street to the bar? How about some decent, and massive, empanadas with green salsa? Yes? Well, then walk to the back of the restaurant, put in your order, then walk to the front and pick-up your chicken. Done and done.
Love the chicken!!! And the spicy Aji (green salsa) and it's fast!  I haven't tried the empanadas because I always get chicken but I'm definitely trying them next time!

BEST broiled chicken in town....you can take a whole chicken for 10 $ dine in experience sucks...usually this place is packed on weekends and the staff insufficient. ...if you dont care for service and want a good tasty meal this place is for you...you Get what you pay....a cheap tasty meal....
I give this place 5 stars! Food, service, and prices were great! Wait time for your is amazingly fast!

Ordered for pickup for 8:00, arrived early at 7:55, waited until 8:20 for entire order.  Half of the order was ready, sat and waited for the rest, so half the order was cold when I got home.  Maybe done in only, avoid take out.  Doubt I'll be back
The chicken here is way more delicious than the other Brasa Roja on Addison. This place is good. Definitely a 5 star rating.
Chicken breast with garlic is delicious here! Big portions too and it's Byob if you're looking for a low key, hassle free dinner.
Food just like you were in South America.  The roast chicken is the best.  And so cheap!

Whole chicken + empanada + corn pancake with cheese = date night, solved.  I was really impressed not just with the tenderness of the fall-off-the-bone chicken, but with its seasoning. Wonderfully balanced and complemented perfectly by the boiled potato and salsa. Comfort food at its simple, elegant best.
The rotisserie chicken was delicious and a little salty.  The sides of a plain rice and beans were okay.  Service was good but I would definitely give this place 2 $$ for price.

I've been here a million times.  The very best value in Chicago!  $9.99 for a whole chicken that you can't possibly finish unless you have 2 very hungry people.  Makes great leftovers as well and the salsa verde is unreal.  I've tried to make it myself 15 times and still have yet to come close!

The rotisserie chicken was delicious deserves 5 stars! We had the whole chicken platter and shared with my husband for lunch and still had more to take home. The seasoning is super tasty and the chicken is tender inside. The plantains and rice were a stale and cold, that's why I took down a star. The soup was good, too. The Columbian decor is cute and the service was ok. We will definitely come back.

Unfortunately, I have to give this place a star after several attempts at failingt to get the tender chicken I originally experienced several years ago.  About two months ago I purchased the chicken dinner which was overly salty. ( could not return at that moment since I had ordered out).  Just yesterday I decided to give it another shot, once again disappointed chicken was tough, the plantain was hard not sweet.  I have given up on this place.

The attraction here is the MEAT.  The 1/2 or whole chickens are GREAT.  But do not forget to try the CHICKEN BREAST WITH GARLIC- a winner, too! The steaks are VERY TASTY but don't expect melt-in-your-mouth tenderness- you can't get that at these prices.  But they are not tough, either- and their flavor is great. I recommend also having one of the Jugos en Leche or Jugos en Agua- very good fruit drinks.  My favorites are the passionfruit or the blackberry.  I have not tried any of the seafood; I like the chicken and steak so well that I have to order one of my favorites from those categories when I come. The sides that come with the meats are OK. I think if you are Colombian you will find them nice and familiar.  To my palate they are a bit bland, but I don't come here for the potato - I come for the MEAT. Prices are super reasonable.

This place has some great food. Their meals are always made as you order and their meats come out on a sizzling platter. Delish. They don't give you much spicy sauce, you have to keep asking...hence the 4 stars.

This little restaurant is on the corner, The parking was hard to find but once we parked and went inside it was nice and cozy. They have specials for $5.00 pretty cheap and great food! We ordered a whole chicken, everywhere else we tried chicken was dry and bland. But La Brasa Roja's chicken was so moist and juicy and the seasoning was fantastic. Even the skin was crispy and delicious! The fried bananas were okay as well. I defintitley will go back and have some! another happy customer~
Cheap eats,  grab a whole chicken and two boiled potatoes for about $10. Golden brown skin and flavorful when their hot.
Great place for quick eats. Simple menu. However, the Chicken can be a bit dry. Although, it's my third or fourth try there.

I've been coming here for YEARS. My Husband loves the empanadas. They started out as perfection when we first ate them. They are just as consistently delicious & perfectly prepared as they've always been. These alone are reason enough to come here - but the rest of their food is GREAT too!

The chicken is delicious! It's BYOB which is great the plantains are sometimes under cooked,  but the staff are great.  Side note ladies,  the first bathroom stall needs to be repaired, it doesn't lock.  Overall,  good food at a good price.

The best chicken I have ever had. They offered a 1/4 chicken with rice, beans, and salad and I went for it. The chicken was perfect tender inside and crispy outside. And even though I prefer dark meat chime  as more flavorful, they didn't ask and gave me white meat. I can only imagine how good the thigh tastes! But in all this chicken heaven, don't forget this place has a number of Colombian dishes including fried whole plantains and cheese filed arepas. They have Columbian tamales and probably other dishes off-menu.

Starting to wonder about the reviewers in this neighborhood. Went to this restaurant based on the rave reviews.  The food was ok. The service was inattentive.  The fruit flies we had to keep swatting away, we're obnoxious. I witnessed a server dumping used salsa from other customers into a clean bowl and putting it back in fridge for re-use. We asked if they had tortillas and were presented with a pack that was microwaved and ripped to shreds when we tried to separate.

Seriously I think these people are wizards!  It's amazing my fiancé and I eat here at least twice a week out of craving. The rotisserie is amazing and a solid deal ten dollars also, not on the unhealthy side. My fiancé loves the chicken with garlic which smells strong on the garlic if you did garlic I gather it's a must have.
All I can say is that I wish I had found this place years ago. It is simply the best spit roasted chicken I've ever had.

This is a great place you never will get wrong from one of their specials and is absolute delicious their food. Rest maybe will need some improve decoration wise soon but for the rest great food, good prices and nice staff. I recommend bandeja paisa and both of the 5 dollars special are awesome (steak or rotisserie chicken).
Great food love the chix special eat here daily

Excellent food and service. The food is reasonably priced, consistently good and I don't think I have had better chicken anywhere. And they have freshly squeezed juices, which is rare. I like the blackberry juice.

This place has some of the best chicken I have ever tasted.. not to mention their special for 4.99, 2 pieces of their amazing chicken, rice, beans and a small salad. The price is amazing not to mention so is their food!! What are you waiting for try it for yourself and you will see!! :)
Great tasty chicken.  Love the coating on the chicken skin.  Everything else was just ok.  would go back for the chicken.

This is the best rotisserie chicken you've ever had in your life.. Super good deal, 10 bucks for a whole chicken, platano's and something else that I don't usually eat, but whatever, the chicken is straight crack..Sometimes I just get two whole chickens and some sauces to go..

I've never eaten in here, but I've gotten food to go several times. I've ordered their rotisserie chicken dinners, and that chicken is truly outstanding. I haven't tried any of their other entrees, but I definitely will soon. Their plantains are also cooked perfectly. It's mesmerizing to watch the chicken guy keep up with the 2 dozen or so birds he has going at one time, and manage all of the orders. It's really very impressive! Their flan is also homemade and very delicious.

This  is a great and affordable place to eat.  For 4.95 you can have grilled rotisserie chicken or steak with beans and rice.  Not a bad deal and the portion size is great! The staff is always friendly and willing to help. It's a very nice neighborhood restaurant!

The first thing you'll notice is that you can smell this place before you can even see it. The heavenly scent stretches down the street, tickles my nose and lifts me off of my feet like in an old Looney Tunes cartoon. Once you're inside, note their crazy setup. They have an actual charcoal grill inside spinning an impressive number of Chickens. I've never counted, but I'd guess 50-75 at a time. As other reviewers have noted, this place is all about the chicken.  Their 1/4 Chicken Lunch Special is absolutely perfect in every way. DELICIOUS chicken, tasty beans and rice and a small salad for under $5.00!  Also, their meat pies (empanadas) are great. I recommend adding a couple to your order.  The only thing I don't love about this place are the sides you get with the Chicken Dinner Specials. The plantains are okay, the whole potatoes are underwhelming and the corn cake is a tasteless rubber puck, gross. When my family gets dinner there, we simply order a la carte. We get a whole chicken, a side of rice and a side of beans. My wife and son and I always have more than enough to eat this way.
Everything here is amazing. It is a great place for family, dates, friends...anyone! Being BYOB never hurts either. Empanadas are to die for with the salsa verde and lime.
This place knocks it out the park.  Dishes are amazing.   Food grilled to perfection.  Love it. Would go back.

Amazing comfort food! Recommendations: to start get yourself at least a couple empanadas, as a main dish I'd recommend either the rotisserie chicken that's thrown directly on the coals right before it's served to you and is nothing short of succulent or the national dish called the bandeja paisa which is heart cloggingly delicious. As you eat be sure to wash it all down with a guanabana con leche "milkshake". Finally, for desert try the brevas con arequipe. You will feel the cavities forming immediately, but they are worth every filling. Provecho.
So,  we used to love this place, last 2 times been shorted a breast and given a back piece.uhm....no thanks, looking for a new spot, am reduced to roasting a chicken myself!

Best rotisserie chicken I've ever had, hands down. You can feed two very hungry adults $10 -- whole chicken, plantains, a couple of small potatoes, and a corn cake. I'll literally go in here on Sundays and get two chickens -- one for us to eat that night, and the other to shred for lunches for the rest of the week. Easy peasy. Chicken -- So good. So, so good. Plantains -- Usually good. Sometimes a little undercooked. Potatoes -- Usually good, but how can you mess these up? Corn cakes -- I can always do without these dry disks. Blech. I haven't had anything else here. I don't really think I could go there WITHOUT getting the chicken, so... I'll leave that to someone else to review! Oh, here's a tip when ordering takeout so you don't look like an amateur: Walk straight to the back to place your order. Then bring your receipt to the front and give it to the guy at the counter to get your chicken.

it would be tough to argue that this isn't the very best food available in the immediate area around montrose & kedzie.  these people friggin know how to do chicken, hard in the MFN paint.  i've never seen it not busy, and wheeoooo that green salsa is so damn good.

My fiancé and I are still kicking ourselves that we've lived in this hood for 2 years, and only just discovered brasa. Their roasted chicken is PHENOMENAL. It's so simple and fantastic, smoky, and seasoned to perfection. For a cheap 10 dollar meal you can split between two people, come here.

As a Colombian, I know my food! Food: Every time my coworkers want chicken, I take purchase chicken from this place. Everyone loves it. There are no complaints and it's beyond affordable. You'll love everything. I recommend the Matrimonio OR the Churrasco for all the meat eaters, who don't want to buy the full chicken. Chicken or steak special: $5! Who can beat that? Service: Normal. This place is not fancy. Locations: There's one location near Kedzie and montrose and another near Irving Park and Elston. Stop by and be casual. You won't regret it!

I went here with a large group and I ordered chicken which came with Colombian rice and beans.  I went here so long ago so I don't remember what the dish was called on the menu but the chicken was flat and grilled.  And OMG was it amazing! This was the first time I've ever been to a Colombian restaurant so I didn't know what to expect,  but I cannot rave enough about this place! The chicken,  beans, and rice taste amazing together and the empanadas are authentic and delicious as well.  I live in the Northwest suburbs so La Brasa Roja is pretty far to go whenever I get a craving.  If only they opened one closer I'd be there every other day.  I seriously get cravings for this place and I've only been here once lol.  The prices are great if you go to the Montrose location.  Overall,  definately a must go! Even if you're not in the area,  you won't be disappointed!

This place is simple, inexpensive, and most importantly very good. I recommend this place for just about anyone. Groups, families, couples, etc. It's a typical neighborhood joint that can easily go unnoticed like a lot of Chicago restaurants not located in the more notable areas of the city. The chicken is tender and juicy. It's seasoned well and the home made salsa verde goes great with it. A whole chicken is around $10 if I'm not mistaken. Chicken comes with potatoes and fried plantains. They also, have rabbit on the menu. I personally enjoyed the rabbit a little more than the chicken. The texture wasn't very different, but the rabbit did seem a little sweeter. They do offer many other Columbian dishes but this isn't your typical Columbian steak house. This has more of whole in the wall Triple D type feel to it. Not romantic in any way. I believe they do carry out as well. I like to joke that after I ate here I got chicken pox at the age of 30 a couple of days after I dined since I hadn't gotten them when I was younger lol. Obviously there is no correlation but a little corny humor never hurt anyone and neither will this awesome food.

We have had their empanadas before and love them BUT we have never eaten there. Today me and my fiancé decided to order food along with our empanads. We ordered the chicken with creol sauce this is where our experice went downhill. I asked for no onions and my dish had a lot of onions the waiter didn't apologize at first but then made his way back and saw me picking them out with a dissatisfied face. He then appologized and said he told the cool no onions but paid no attention to him. The dish I general was not enjoyable, it lacked flavor and was not enjoyable. Now I'm not a customer that complains but when came around a second time he knew we did not like our meal and that I was upset at the onions I had ordered to not be on my dish. The least they could have done was to buy my dish but i am not the type to go and complain as i said before. All and all the experice wasn't good the waiter didn't take the initiative I expected him to, looks like we will stick to only getting the empanadas to go.
Great food!!! If you are new, visiting Chicago, i suggest you to try them. It is great place

It's still the best roasted chicken in the city. I had a half chicken the other day that was a bit dry.  It was still awesome.  I'm only mentioning that because even on their worst day, it's still awesome. I recently tried the empanadas while waiting for the chicken, they are good.
Our go-to place for rotisserie chicken. No one does it better. Out-of-town guests are always amazed!

I am not usually a big meat person but something they do to theirs is absolutely delicious! The chicken and beef both. Plus you can watch the rotisserie chickens cooking and eat the authentic columbian sides.

"bawk bawk bawk" (dances like a spazz ala Arrested Development) Rotisserie chicken! Yup. $11 for a whole chicken w fried plantains. And this motherclucker is juicy and succulent. The empanadas are bitchin as well meaty and with a masa (some call it corn) crust, what the cluck they're just a buck. Cafeteria blech atmosphere and mundane service. However the chick tastes so good whenever I'm in the area I'm livin la brasa roja.
$4.95 for the chicken or skirt steak special, drooling as i'm typing this review!!!

I came here after seeing several cop cars lined up out front for lunch.  I usually use this as an indicator of fine ethnic cuisine.  My instincts were correct and the chicken here is mighty delicious. I usually order the whole chicken.  Moist, crispy/blackened skin are what you should be looking for at La Brasa.  Get there early for the fresh stuff! Friendly service, great food.  Love this joint!
Chicken was great, the arepas were delicious! The aji needs a little but more flavor that is why I gave them a four stars!
Pretty yummy chicken and plantains!!  Extremely clean. Affordable. Will surely order again.
This place is great for authentic Colombian food and the prices are good.
Chicken was great. Colombiana soda was yummy. Empanadas were only $1.00 and good. Dinner for two came up to $26. Inexpensive and delicious.

Amazing chargrilled chicken and one helluva combo deal! For like $5, you get it all. My friend Max lives across the way from this place and he goes weekly. I would too if I lived in his 'hood. They've got a green sauce to put on your steak or chicken which is magnifico!  Give this place your dollars and you won't be sorry.

The chicken at La Brasa Roja is really tender and flavorful. You can order a half or full order of chicken that comes paired with boiled potatoes, a sweet fried plantain, and a somewhat strange biscuit.  The ambiance of the place doesn't feel great, but I typically just get the food to-go since its nearby. They are always really quick and really cheap for the great quality and quantity you get. The chicken for the two of us costs $12!! That's two meals!!  I highly recommend getting the charred chicken! It's so delicious!!

I am ambivalent about my experiences at Brasa Roja.  They definitely have good food: The roasted chicken is deliciously flavorful and moist, but my favorite things are the Colombian-style empanadas, which have a masa crust instead of a flour one (on a funny note, they are referred to as "meat turnovers" on the English menu, but "empanada" is one of those crossover words like "taco" and "quesadilla" that need not be translated); nevertheless, at $1 a pop, they are a can't-miss! Service is ... serviceable, but it's often rushed and no-frills. I'm not bothered by this given that it's a quick, eat-and-go kind of place. However, what bothered me at my last visit was seeing the cooks wheel a garbage bin full of raw whole chickens on spits from the back to the wood-burning grills upfront. I'm assuming -- and very hopeful that I'm correct -- that this bin has not been re-purposed, and that is is exclusively used to transport chickens. But it definitely left me with a temporary icky feeling.  Sometimes, ignorance is bliss.
Delicious!!  Their steaks and chicken are tender and have that grilled smokey flavor to it. Good stuff! The sides are ok And I love their empanadas. Very tasty.

I'm so disappointed with this place! Went for lunch with my family and got cold chicken! Platanos were sitting for what must of been too long what I would describe a Caucho leather like. And freezer burned arepas :( big time let down........... Service in a rush and incomplete.
So so good.A little dive but Big on flavor!!! Every time I get invited to a party I'm tasked to bring The Chicken. I do with pleasure
Good, cheap and enough for leftovers. Great meal.

i've been here so many times in my life, i have been going to this restaurant for almost 12 years, but last time i went it was a total rip off, everyone please look out when you sign your receipt!! please do not leave blank the tip area otherwise they will rip you off!! and enter the amount they want!! very good food but they will get as much tip as they can!!!!!! horrible, horrible, horrible, horrible, rip off, rip off, rip off, rip off, rip off!!

So far La Brasa Roja is our favorite roast chicken in the city and this location is the best of the LBR's. Stop in with $15 in hand and you can walk out with the best marinaded roasted chicken with  sides (roasted potatoes and plantains) and grab a couple of empanadas to boot. I guarantee this will be one of the best $15 meals you can get that easily feeds a family of 3 to 4. Yes, you can eat here, but the few minutes of rest the chicken gets on the ride home only enriches the flavor of the meat.

Pretty good.  I had the whole chx and my family had the garlic chx with yuca and plantain bananas.  I had never tried yuka before and found it very tasty...like a potato, sort of.  Maybe it is a potato, not sure.  Great deal though...$40 for 3 adults, 2 kids.  not bad.

I love this place! I must admit that the first time I was here, the place looked sketchy. My friend and I still ate here and it was suprisingly good. We ordered the half chicken and half steak dinner. When our plate came, I saw that the chicken was white meat and I prayed that it was not dry. The chicken was surprisingly tender and well marinated! The steak was juicy and you must try the green sauce that they put on the table right when you sit down. It goes well with the chicken and steak! It was a good portion for the both of us and we finished everything because it was so good. This place is very affordable and portions are not bad for the price. They also have a cheap lunch special! Lastly, this place is BYOB and I didn't realize it till the last time i was here.

This place is ridiculously delicious.  I live not even a block away and I'm SO glad because I'll be frequenting this place often.   To be honest, I wasn't crazy about any of the sides that we got with the meal.  The beans were meh, the plantains, were, like whatever, but the CHICKEN...OMG...the CHICKEN.   Whatever seasonings that they use on the chicken are simply delicious and it's grilled, probably all day which gives it a delicious smoky flavor.  Maybe I'll check out some other stuff on the menu, but probably not.  The chicken is just where it's at.  Run, don't walk to this place.  You won't go wrong!
Great Chicken and Rabbit! Very well priced, very quick, good sides (plantains)! Will be eating again and often! :) The wall murals inside are nice too.

This place is amazing. It's a little BYOB that serves quality food. Furthermore, Brasa Roja is very affordable. You can get a whole chicken with 3 sides for 10 dollars! One plate can feed you for days.  Very, very relaxed atmosphere and appears to be family owned. Its never really packed, so seating is never a problem.  I've tried the rotisserie chicken and creole chicken - both savory and delish in their own way. I would highly recommend this place if you just want to relax and unwind. My boyfriend and I ordered an appetizer and two dinner plates and it was under 30 dollars. You just can't beat that!  Go there! :)

Brasa Roja has a fairly large menu, so my 5-star review is based on just a few dishes -- the whole roasted chicken and the steak. Sweet and simple: that is one tasty bird. Inexpensive, comes with nice sides, and the green sauce they provide is delicious. This is the only Colombian-style chicken place I go to anymore. Great stuff.

Super awesemo! Wife had the silverfish, fried just right and delicious. Sons had the short ribs,and garlic chicken. I had the combo plate with a piece of steak, sausage and fried pork belly. Sides included fried plantain  and a potato like root vegetable, rice, beans. Everything was good, especially the meats. The place is clean and simple. Service was good. Price is very reasonable for what you get.

Sometimes the cheapest dinner can be the BEST dinner ever. No frills, no drama, no mean hostess, no high-end servers - just pure juicy chicken, tasty steak, delicious rice...I think I will be heading out now to go back to La Brasa Roja!

I've been living next to this place for as long as I can remember, but I only stepped in the first time a few months ago.  I was sad that this has been here for so long and I'd never eaten her, but glad I finally did! Two words to describe this place: CHEAP and YUMMY.  What more can you ask for? You can get a whole roasted chicken, plus sides, for $10.  Since a few months ago, I've spent many an afternoon greasing up my fingers and happily unbuttoning my pants.  The garlic chicken is also fantastic---it's served on a sizzling platter.  It's very good value for what you get and what you pay.  I also like the ambience here--it's not too dive-y, like Mexican taquerias or some other Latin American places can be.  It's a casual restaurant, and the service is good. Come here! (Especially if you live nearby!)
there are no words for how amazing this chicken is. no words. best roast chicken in all the land.

Awesomeszzzzzzz.  My girlfriend told me she wanted to go here because someone at work reheated their leftovers and it smelled so amazing she needed to go to there. I've been to the one on Elston and Irving and the menu appears to be the same at both places. They sell both half ($7.99) and whole roasted ($9.99) chicken but just get the whole goddamn thing because you will want to eat that thing for days. The longer you can delay this chicken meal running out, the better.  I got the garlic chicken, which was also incredible. Thinly pounded chicken that's coated in a garlic paste and charcoal grilled. It comes on a sizzling wooden platter with a bunch of other amazing sides. I think that was $13.  Empanadas are $1 and amazing.  I think it's BYOB.  I love this place.

Tried this place for the first time last night based off yelp reviews and its location and very pleased.  I loved the fact the chicken was cooked over the open flame and you could see it cooking at the front of the location.   I placed the order for pick up and arrived within minutes and had a very short wait (less than 3 minutes).  Fast!  One note, I did have to wait for someone else to take my order over the phone as English was a barrier. I had the garlic chicken breast, which was really good.  It was more $$ than the whole chicken, but I liked not having the bones and not a dark meat person.  The chicken was not a "breast" but rather cut up and some slices/chunks.  Very tasty and smelled great.  Also order the whole chicken for someone else and they seemed to like and commented it was alot of chicken. :)   Good food and reasonable price, will go back!

Yeah, best chicken ever. Whole fire roasted rotisserie Colombian chicken for $10.  Cannot beat it.  We're already dreading the cravings for this place after we move away. They do run out of chicken, so be advised.  No surprise though, the chicken is that good.

Best chicken of my entire life. BEST. Where else can three people eat until they are physically incapable of continuing for less than $20 total? The chicken was amazing, the plantains were amazing, and might I recommend the meat turnovers. Also, the food comes out hot in less than 5 minutes. You order it and BAM, it's there.

They have the worse customer service and even when I've phoned in my order  20 minutes earlier they still mess up my order and never apologize. Today I called in my order 25 minutes later I go in and the waitresses are asking each other who took my order and then practically call me a lier how I must have placed it at their other location and not until I phoned in right in front of their did they believe me and still no apology. Food was good now it's typicall and by the time I eat I am to upset to enjoy their food 2 thumbs down did I say Horrible service

La Brasa Roja is located is on the north side of Chicago. Street parking shouldn't be much of a problem because most of the immediate area is made up of small businesses and homes. Sitting smack dab on the corner, the place is hard to miss. Although aesthetically you may not be wowed, you will be by the food. The prices are more than fair considering their sizes and portions and that makes it a great deal. Perhaps the only real quirk that I have is that the menu is in Spanish. So this can make it a bit difficult to navigate around it if you don't read Spanish.  But overall La Brasa Roja is simple, cheap, and delicious, what more could one want?
The best place to get rotisserie chicken and fried plantain.

I passed by Brasa Roja many times. I thought Colombian food was great because I  experienced dining in at Las tablas Colombian steak house i had a fantastic experience at the Lincoln location the Irving location had great food but the service wasn't as good well to sum it up Brasa Roja sucks the meat is cheap. Brasa Roja only has one sever she is slow, and rude. Outside and  inside it isn't decorated well. I wont be coming to La Brasa Roja anymore.

This is the best place to get roasted chicken. I have had it several times and its always cooked to perfection! Its so tasty and juicy!! The meal comes with potatoes, corn bread and a fried plantain. Great meal for a great price! Highly recommended!

you get a lot of food for the price! The only thing is that  it's just too greasy for my taste. But great flavor.  I love the plantains, empanadas, arepas, fish and of course the roasted chicken. The menu is very Colombian, not like other places that think that Colombian food is like Mexican. The figs with arequipe, not my favorite. Tasted like out of can. Thats the reasin why I dont give it 5 stars.

Here is a very brief list of things you can get for $10: 1. 10 large Cokes from McDonalds. 2. Two feet of sandwiches from Subway. 3. 5 Double Stacks from Wendys.  or A WHOLE FREAKING CHICKEN, POTATOES, A CORN CAKE AND A FRIED ASS PLANTAIN.  So I just moved back to Chicago, my city of choice. And lo and behold down the street is Brasa Roja, which loosely translates to HOLY SHIT BALLS THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. For $10 (plus $2 for an extra corn cake and cheese) we got an entire chicken with enough accouterments to satisfy anyone and it was fresh, delicious and fast. You pay, they give you a receipt to take to the chicken dude in front and you leave with a motherfucking awesome chicken in a styrofoam box. It's really that easy. The chicken was a little dry, altho considering it's roasted that's not unexpected. Still, the food is amazing, fast and so, so good. I see getting a lot of chicken from Brasa Roja. A dinner most fowl never tasted so fucking good.

Hands down the best roast chicken I've ever had in my life. I used to live down the block from this place, and the smell alone is enough to give it a good review.  I've been here countless times, I always get the chicken, and the future wife gets some sort of meat dish, whether it's short ribs, flank steak, or ny strip. Each entree comes with plenty of sides, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and plantains, but the secret is the green tomatillo sauce which you pour over the rice. Unfortunately it's been years since we've been there, because we moved to the west coast, but my future wife still talks about it.  Honestly, I'm yelping about it right now, because I had a dream about the chicken last night, and so will you

Gold mine!  Close to where I live and the food is really good.  We had the NY strip and the roasted chicken.  Plenty of sides: corn cake, potatoes, rice, plantain...  byob as well!  The place also does lamb and even hen and rabbit!  Going back to try the rabbit...

We came for lunch one day and we walked into a busy restaurant with delicious looking chicken roasting near the window. We ordered roasted chicken - ok, not as flavorful or crispy as i imagined roasted rabbit - ok, needed more meat and flavor! empanadas - really crispy skin roasted vegetables - flavorless and dry fried plantain - too fried in general the food was good, but not as good as i imagined it to be. Needs more salt and flavor!

I came on yelp to see some feedback on what others think, if it's just me or if this place just really sucks! We gave this place a try, since we live two blocks down..and everyone was raving about it. We gave it not one chance, but two! Thinking, maybe we got a bad dish. My GF got the steak, I opted for chicken. The chicken wasn't so bad, however the steak I actually had to re cook for my gf ! Even though I asked for well done, it was still pink...and a bit dry. I honestly I think I could have done better making it myself altogther. let's just say a lot of A1 sauce was needed !! We tried the it again a second time, thinking it was just a bad experience.. and we still were disappointed. We felt we just paid too much for meals we could have made outselves, and didn't really enjoy at all....

La Brasa Roja never disappoints! Quite the opposite in fact. You get a lot of really great food for an extremely reasonable price. The two things I get the most are the half-chicken (comes with a rice cake, plantain, boiled potatoes) or the steak and chicken combo plate (with yucca fries, plantain, boiled potatoes, and a little chimichurri on the side). Everything is absolutely delicious. Their chicken is the best I've ever had, hands down. The chicken is tender and moist. Whatever they're rubbing on it before they roast it is what I'd like to refer to as "chicken-crack" because, yuh-huh, it's just that good. You can find me at the La Brasa Roja sucking on the chicken skin every time I eat there. I don't care if this practice is repulsive to others. When I am eating this chicken, nothing else really matters. The smell is a big part of what draws me to this restaurant. When they're a cookin', the smell beckons me from a block away and I know, at that moment, that I need it. I am and always will be a die hard fan of La Brasa Roja. Go! SOON!
Just go! Doit! Dont be afraid. $5.95 for rice, beans and chicken or steak. Oh god! So good. Dont forget to get an empanada. Seriously, for the money its well worth it.

I went expecting the same wonderful taste as Pueblito Viejo.. definitely not! I went on a monday night... this place was not busy at all.. so why does it take your waitresses 15 mins to offer us something to drink? When she brought back our drinks.. they were pretty warm.. then it took her another 15 mins to take our order.. I ordered a carne asada with an arepa and a potato and fried yuca.. the carne asada was pretty dry and the arepa was pretty dry as well.. the service was not good at all.. they took forever for everything, and of course the food was dry and the drinks were warm... never again shall I go there.

Too...stuffed...too...type.... Amazingness.  The fact that this place has been down the street from me and I've never checked it out is incredible....although when considering the stellar yumminess (and ridiculous cheapness) of their empanadas my waistline is happier!  Honest.  I was stuffed after 2 of them and STILL had to tackle part of the mouth watering half chicken (whatever they're seasoning these chickens with? muchas gracias!) potatoes, plantain, and arepa that came with generous green sauce.   Needless to say I was glad I had gotten take out so I could change into comfy sweats and collapse on the couch!

This is the lowest  rating I have given to a restaurant. A friend of mine was boasting about it and he mentioned it was BYOB, so we picked up some beer and headed over there. We ordered the chicken platter and the silver fish (whole) with garlic. I was disappointed with the chicken, it was dry and heavily seasoned for my taste.  The fish was the worse of the two entrees, it was "desiccated". You had to pick through everything to get to the good bits that were way over cooked and had tiny bones you had to weed through on top of that. The chicken was so-so,the plantains and the potatoes were cooked perfectly it just had way too much seasoning. In fairness maybe the other locations are better than the one on Montrose but it's not likely I'll be going back.

2nd time around for cinco de Mayo.. and just the perfect meal to wind down the day!  Invited a friend (Chef & professor at Culinary Institute) who's been itching to try out the spot & he liked it a lot!  The Chicken and Steak Combo. Can of Diet Coke.  With a side of Extra extra garlic paste.  This time around, I managed to finish 85% of plate. I was prepping my stomach for this feast.  Sigh... their chicken is seriously so tender, and I really enjoy that charcoal grilled taste.  Service was friendly and I ordered another chicken and steak combo to go, which came out in a jiffy. It's like they knew I was going to order another meal! lol  Next time, I swear.. I'll try something else.  No no... I'll get the chicken and steak combo with a side of empanadas. Yea.. that sounds divine.

We just got back from this place and OMG it was delicious!!!!!! It's true service is not that good but so what!!! the meat was out of this world and chicken was amazing!!! I would definitely come back. I can even say that this is the best steak I have ever had.
Cheap - $5 Special gets you half a grilled chicken/ steak, rice & beans, and salad. The best part is its delicious and filling :)

Best rotisserie chicken in Chicago! It reminds me so much of home (Brazil). My husband and I usually order it to go. Don't care for the arepa that comes with the chicken though. We've ordered other plates there but just end up going back for the chicken.

It's become a staple for my family since we moved to the neighborhood. Delicious, juicy roasted chicken is the star here. You'll see when you walk in the door and notice the gigantic rotisserie oven with dozens of chickens rotating in the fire. It's just solid home cooking, a totally reliable place for take-out or easy/comfortable and inexpensive dining.

unpretentious, delicious food.  juicy, charbroiled chicken.  $4.99 meals!  yucca fries done just right.  i've tried the chicken and the steak and i think i like the chicken better.  they definitely got that down pat.  they have these fruit drinks that can come with or without milk.  it's out of the way from downtown obviously but my brazilian friend who used to live in the area still takes the bus back here just to eat.  that says a lot about the food and the atmosphere.  i would definitely come back here again!

The best rotisserie chicken in Chicago!  Hands down!  This place is my Kenny Rogers Roasters.  I have a hard time driving home without stopping!  It's succulent, sweet and smokey.  I get the full chicken to-go all the time.  For $10, it comes with a plantain, some potatoes and an arepa (a round piece of bread made from cornmeal).  It's worth the trip for sure.

My husband and I went to La Brasa Roja tonight for dinner.  Super yum!  We shared a whole chicken (with potato, plantain and yucca) and got a side of rice. The rice might not look like anything special but it's really good.  The place is lacking in ambiance but the food more than makes up for it.  Probably the best chicken I've ever had.  And the empanadas were awesome!!  I also really liked the passion fruit drink (with water). This might be our new weekly cheap dinner restaurant!

I really wanted to like this place since it's right down the street and I love Colombian food, however, it let me down not just once but twice! The first time I bought takeout, a 1/4 white meat chicken and it was as dry and flavorless as a spoonful of sand. The second time I went, my husband and kids joined me and when we entered, I saw the owner sitting at the back table by the kitchen and he was on the phone but made eye contact with me, never once signaling me to take a seat, so basically ignored us. So we sat by the front and an elderly couple and their adult children came in and also stood at the front waiting for direction on whether to take a seat or wait, the owner just looked right at them without saying a word. They figured it out, like we did, and just sat wherever they fancied.  We ordered our drinks, a coke, and an empanada from the smiley waitress and she leaves, five minutes later a male waiter comes by and asks us what we'd like to get started with and we informed him we had already placed that order with the waitress so he leaves. He comes back a few minutes later with our drinks and proceeds to take our dinner order. I order the matrimonio as did my husband and my kids ordered the chicken breast plate. Had to order rice and beans on the side as the dish didn't come with it. Minutes pass and our food arrives and I ask about the empanada  which I had a craving for and he was surprised and said he didn't know I ordered it.  All of our chicken dishes were dry and super garlicky. I love garlic but not enough to sweat it out of my pores at the end of the day. The beans were flavorless as was the rice. I'm really disappointed with the service and the food. I've given it many chances and I know that sometimes restaurants have off days but that still doesn't make up for the lack of good customer service. The owner looking at customers coming in and not saying as much as "hello" baffles me.  I'll never go back there again and I don't feel I got my moneys worth, I actually feel ripped off.

Best fried yucca with green salsa... Great Passionfruit drink (no milk)... These are the reasons I come here.  It can get a bit chilly if you sit in the side room as it is not helped by the charcoal oven and has large windows.  Nice people and I recommend it.

How is this not 5 stars I have no idea.  This place is amazing for the value I go here for lunch a couple times a week and they have an amazing quarter chicken special with rice and beans for under 5 bucks! They even have a rib eye special for the same price and the rib eye they give you is a good size. The rice is very tasty along with the beans but the chicken tastes amazing and you can really taste the smokey taste from the rotisserie fire as they use a combination of coals and wood to cook the chicken. I have yet to go back for dinner but I plan too soon. I mean where else can you get rotisserie rabbit?

I am a white boy thru and thru, but i LOVE me some Brasa Roja!!! First off, the epinadas are awesome!!  The are $1 apiece and i can eat 4-5 @ a given time easily.  in fact, there have been many times, i just stop in to grab a couple to bring home and eat.(i live around the block) The roasted Chicken that you see in the windows is also REALLY good as well.  There is actually so much on the menu i havent tried because i am such a fan of the same ol, same ol. Defintely give this place a try if you are in the hood....u will not be dissappointed!!!!
Best rotisserie chicken in Chicago.  Truly Colombia.

Possibly the best roasted chicken in the city. Definitely the best value in the city! My friends and I visit at least once a month. We start with an order of tostones (crispy fried plantains) with chimchurri (parsley, oregano, garlic, olive oil) sauce and move on to the whole roasted chicken dinner, which comes with two potatoes, arepa (cornmeal bread) and a sweet plantain. A hearty meal for two (or leftovers to take home) for about $15.

When you walk in to this place, the aroma alone lets you know that you are in for a treat.  That, and the sight of the rotisserie chicken in the front.  We picked up a chicken, which comes with a couple of potatoes and plantains, to go.  We added beans and rice. The chicken was quite possible the best rotisserie chicken in the city.   *If you are going in for takeout, go straight to the back.  They'll take your order there; pick it up in the front.  That, and a little bit of Spanish goes a long way in this place.  Awesome food.  Good find!
The empanadas are really good. They're made with chicken and potatoes. Only a dollar each but big enough and well worth it.

I went here expecting to eat the roasted chicken because everyone on yelp raves about the chicken. Instead i decided to get a grilled steak and a chicken breast. The waitress didn't ask how i wanted my steak cooked so they brought it well done even though i prefer it medium. The chicken was breast was dry, the Yuca was actually pretty good and the fried plantains were good. I ordered a mango drink made with actual mangoes and it was delicious. I guess next time I go I have to try the roasted chicken..I would give this place 3 1/2 stars not 4.

Their rotisserie chicken is awesome.   Good empanadas and plantains also.  Very friendly to friendly enough wait staff.  Really this might be the best rotisserie chicken you ever eat.  Get their whole chicken - it is worth every dime!
Best rotisserie chicken ever.  $10 will easily feed 3-4 of us with deliciousness.

My husband and I went and got a whole roasted chicken which comes with plantains and potatoes to go.  The whole order was around $10.86 or something w/tax.  We got it home and it looked/smelled/tasted so good we literally inhaled it.  I mean we started eating it before even sitting down.  We have our own BBQ sauce at home and had some of that w/the chicken.  The potatoes were roasted or something and I didn't think I would like them but they were mild and satisfying and I felt they went well w/the meal.  It made me realize I never have roasted potatoes these days.  The plantain was enormous and sweet -we were both loving it.   My only qualm is that their to-go packaging is styrofoam which I know is common, but technically you are not supposed to eat hot food from styrofoam (and definitely not hot liquids) as it can release toxins.  So, maybe next time I'll ask them to put it into my own container, or maybe I'll just be in denial and enjoy the food.  We will for sure be back.  It's really a crazy value and very satisfying.  As one reviewer mentioned it is a little confusing going in to order.  You actually have to walk all the way back.  There's a cash register and also a kitchen window in back.  A waitress was by the cash register so I paid w/her, she gave me a receipt to bring up front, then I watched them chop up my chicken and assemble my order in seconds.  That looked cool.

The ~$11 whole chicken is to die for, probably the best I've ever had.  Getting carry-out is a bit odd, since you have to pay the waiter in the back where the register is and take the receipt up to the cook in the front to get your food; be sure to call ahead for takeout since they can be a little slow at times.
