I work about a block away from here, and we eat here frequently.  I always get the chicken lunch special.  The total with tax is like $5.??.  All I know is, it's a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get.  You get two huge pieces of chicken, salad, rice, and beans.  For $.50 more you can get an entire pack of heated tortillas.  This cannot be beat.  OMG, the chicken is so good too.  It's roasted rotisserie style over hot coals and seasoned to perfection.  If you haven't tried this place - you are missing out.  The special also comes with a steak option.  Instead of chicken you get a big piece of thin sliced steak that is also seasoned. BTW, don't you dare walk out of there without ordering some of their hot sauce.  It's made with tomatillos and is just effin' delicious. Also, I am giving them four stars strictly because they don't speak english in there too well. I mean, I know it's a columbian place, but I want to eat there too, and it's really hard to order sometimes when they don't understand what I'm saying!  Other than that, the place is fantastic...dining in or taking out.

THE GOOD: This was the first rabbit I've ever had, and it was mind-numbingly succulent. If the spice on the chicken and steak is anywhere near as delicious as the rabbit was, I can understand why people call it the best there is. The empanadas were also simply outstanding! I could easily make a meal out of just these. The service was also very kind and relatively attentive. The flan was brilliant, very dense and creamy with a perfect caramel sauce. THE BAD: Half of our chicharrones were cooked perfectly, the other half were inedibly overcooked, and my husband's whole red snapper was, sadly, very overcooked; we probably should have sent it back.  When we return (and we will --the rabbit and the empanadas were freaking sensational), we'll definitely stay away from the fried meats and stick with the grilled. Considering half our meal was disappointing, the good stuff was still delicious enough to earn this place four stars in my book.

This place has ' THE BEST' CHICKEN in town!!!  Last night was too hot to cook in a hot humid kitchen so we decided to order out. The last time I had a taste for some chicken I was highly disappointed That's because we picked up the grossest chicken from Wriggleyvile Dogs-But that's a different review..  This place always has the juiciest well rotisserie chicken..You definitely get your $$'s worth. You can get a whole meal for you family for just about $10 bucks!! We ordered a whole Rotisserie Chicken and it comes with roasted potatoes, fried plantain and a corn pancake's could of left the corn pancake) But this meal was Delicious!!! You can't go wrong here.  We had so much left we had enough for a second dinner the next day :)

Best damned rotisserie bawk bawk I've ever had!! I'd steal a little kids tricycle to ride there just to get some! Then I'd return it to him after I've eaten and give him some of my leftovers. Oh wait. No i won't, cause there won't be any leftovers!!!

Just went there today and was told by the waiter Oscar who claims he was the manager that he didn't serve my kind here, meaning he didn't want blacks in his restaurant. He proceeded to laugh at me when I told him it was against the law to refuse to service people based on race. I have been out of the country several times and eaten at many South American restaurants in this city and have never been treated so badly.

Was recommended this place by fellow Yelper Jacob J. Went there, and the place was pretty crowded. A nice mom and pop restaurant on a very busy strip of Kedzie. Driving to this place, I recognized a ton of other Yelp winning restaurants...Noon o Kabab, and Al_Khameyieh to name a few. This area is Foodie Galore, cheap, good eats!!!  Ordering is kinda confusing, as you place your order in the back, and not the front, where they have the rotisserie grill being manned by two workers. Was in and out with my 2 quarter chicken orders in less than 15 minutes. By the way, each order, only $4.99 each!!! WOW The chicken is phenomenally affordable chicken. Tender, sweet, succulent...kinda makes you want to stop reading this review and run there huh? Rice is very nice and fluffy, but flavorful too. Has a nice rich, buttery taste. Yum! Side salad was wilted, probably because it was put in the same box as hot items. Forgiveable. Your prize fighter is in the chicken.

I had their roasted chicken the other day. AMAZING! I have never had chicken cooked that way, and I don't want it any other way. I was a bit confused on where to pay for the food, but once I paid it was ready right away. Everything was just perfect! I wish they delivered I would like some now!

oh, la brasa roja. how i love you. Their roasted chicken special is one of the best things on this planet.  Chicken, salad and rice and beans for something like $5. did i mention the chicken is some of the most flavorful and delicious you will ever have  in your life?! do not forget to ask for chimichurri sauce if they neglect to bring you some! now, mix it with your rice and beans and spoon it into your mouth with a piece of chicken= savory heaven.  PS fyi- Ordering to go here is a bit confusing for newcomers- you go to the back and order from a waitress, not in front right where the chickens are roasting.

the chicken is the best effin chicken ever ... that i have ever eaten in my life. it is the bomb. i drive all the way from belmont and cumberland in the middle of our traffic hour to eat this chicken. i know at the mexican store u can get chicken for 5 buks. compared to the ten here, but omg it is such full of flavor. every part of the chicken is juicy i have never taste that in my life. the french fries r good w the chicken and for kids. i tasted the empanada i had grease on the plate and it was ok. i mean it taste authetic but it was not great by any chance. but it was good. just go to joes on lawrence and monticello for ur empanadas . the service was good it was a young latin guy pretty cute.

After dining at the Irving Park Location, we decided to try our luck at this location. While they do offer a larger menu and a much larger capacity on the whole we were not as impressed with the food.  My partner ordered the lamb and it came out dry and chewy. The flavor was excellent but the quality of the lamb could have been better. I ordered the steak and chicken platter. As good as the chicken usually is, which is phenomenal, the steak was even better. We left with enough food to feed another person. We will be going back to try the rabbit. An excellent place for people that are on high protein diets.

I think it's been pretty much all said here...the chicken is excellent, but I wasn't overly impressed with the sides...not sure if it was due to the way it was cooked or if it just wasn't my taste.  Oh, and give the rabbit a try too...it was really wonderful!

This is some of the tastiest chicken I have ever had!  I can't say much for the bland potato pancake but the plantain is also tasty!  It is a huge meal for not alot of money so definitely worth it!  We eat here as often as we can.  They are quick and the chicken is perfect every time.

This is the BEST grilled chicken ever! I pick it up for dinner about once a week and it's always a favorite. Plantains are fantastic but the arepa suffers a bit from being heated in the microwave. Haven't tried anything else or dined in so can't comment on that but the staff is friendly.   Unfortunately, they do sometimes mis-time the grilling of the chicken and run out. That's a huge disappointment. I tried the Pollo Brasa a block or two east once when that happened but it was a poor substitute--and more expensive.

WOW WOW WOW...When I moved from Florida back to Chicago, I did NOT think I was going to have open fired Latin roasted chicken again. I remember from my many times driving to and from O'Hare (because of business trips) about seeing this place, and one time, right after a business trip, I decided to stop in to pick up some food, considering I was starving (since airlines are soo cheap these days that they make you pay $5 for a bag of peanuts!). Ambiance, not much...but then again, I was not eating there (but you can smell the roasted meat once you walk in...and it was TORTURING ME!).  The food...phenomenal.  I ordered a roasted chicken and a churrasco steak to go.  Tender, juicy, spiced and delicious.  And for all the food, it was very reasonable, if not borderline cheap. Two thumbs up...I am happy to have found a place that serves phenomenal Latin/Colombian dishes! One side note...they are not very fluent in English...Charades might be in store!  LOL

my first time here i order empanada, caldo de pollo,tostones,coffee........................empanada was ok,chicken soup blaaa no flavor no salt  and cold,tostones blaa no flavor nothing no garlic sauce hello? coffee they forget my coffee wooou,poooor service i dont think i come back. the chicken look good by the window  thats it.

They are opening a Brasa Roja on Irving Park Road on Oct 2nd.  YES! Can't wait b/c it is so close to us!!!  It is 2 blocks west of Kimball, on the north side of the street - stop by and support their newest location and have delicious food!!!

I was in Colombia just this past December and up until saturday still have not made it to one of the handful of Colombian restaurants in the city. I didnt know much about the country or the cuisine prior to my trip.  The food at La Brasa Roja was even better than what I ate down there. Could they have Americanized it? They surely dumbed down the menu for Americans though. I grabbed a paper take-out menu while we waited to be seated. It was all in Spanish but I felt comfortable reading it. When we sat down we were handed the english menu. I'm sorry but "arepa con chorizo" sounds way better than "sausage with corn cake" and "empanada" sounds more apetizing than "meat turnover."  Really, who doesnt know what a friggin' empanada is?  I had a half rostierre chicken which came with fried plantain and potato for only $6.95! it was so good and I even had leftovers which found their way onto a salad the next day. I especially loved the fruit juice made with water. They offered it in flavors that are not found in most places and reminded me my trip to Colombia, such as maracuya, guanabana (I know youre thinking banana but it's not) and lulo.  We sat there the whole time mumbling about how stinking good the food was and not much else!

I feel like I am majoring in Comparative Roast Chicken Studies here, or at least Comparative Cheap lunches, having just reviewed Brasa's neighbor Pollo Volador, and trying the $4.95 1/4 chicken special at each location.  Brasa Roja offers no choices with their special. The plate comes with a small piece of thigh and a small drumstick, rice and beans which have been slopped on the plate, and the most anemic, lame excuse for "salad" you've ever seen.  It looks like left-overs from someone else's plate. A few slices of iceberg, a small sliver of tomato, and one slice of cucumber. The brown beans were overly salted and the chicken itself was delicious. I know for $5.00 I shouldn't be so critical, but  for the same price you get much more at Pollo Volador: a choice of white or dark (the white meat choice is a healthy serving), a choice of potato or plantain, and a delicious accompaniment of salsa verde. I would like to return to Brasa Roja to try their full price dinner menu, because there are many selections of meat, fish and poultry dishes, and the chicken was very good. Skin-eatin' good!

My family and I have the goal of dining in each Colombian restaurant in Chicago; this one we will go back to. The roast chicken was EXCELLENT, everyone loved everything (which is hard when you take 3 of your kids), and it was so reasonably priced; even with five of us, we ordered a ton of food and it was only about 50 bucks. We got arepas, empanadas, patacones, and some other things and loved it all. Everything was just the way I like and remember it except I excitedly ordered an agua panela with cheese and the cheese melted in the bottom (what the heck?).  Otherwise, it was GREAT! Addendum, third visit, 8/14/09: a few weeks ago, I told my husband I would take him for dinner wherever he wanted to go. It was about 4 in the afternoon, and he tells me to hurry up and get in the car. We hit the freeway and two hours later, we were in Chicago for dinner! Must be worth the drive.

I almost have no words for their Rotisserie Chicken. I have cravings for this bird that drive me insane. Honestly-what do they put on this chicken? some ancient secret Colombian ingredient only sold by the gram here in the states? My mouth waters for this chicken as I am writing this, and I just HAD some for dinner. I have eaten here several times, dine in and carry out. Never been disappointed. The churrasco is yummy too- I can't decide whose is better, theirs or Las Tablas. The chimichurri sauce is almost identical. I would rather have the yuca than the arepa that you get at LBR. It's a tasteless white corn cake that I can do without. I don't even think a slice of cheese alone could help it. But that damned chicken? I tell everyone about this place. Prices are pretty reasonable. I ordered a 1/2 chicken, rice and chimichurri, they were out of platanos tonight, so they  gave me 3 potatoes instead. All for $10.30. The only complaint is the $2 side order of rice. Kind of a joke, but maybe its cuz I'm 1/2 Asian and love my white rice with just about everything! Empanadas aren't bad-could use more filing though. The dinner with the fried egg, steak and chicharron is friggin good too. too bad they don't have a steak and roast chicken combo. That would be perfection on a plate!  I have to say, I have NEVER gone here and they were out of Chicken! I read those reviews and was surprised.   But-I get lucky every time I go. sigh. . . YUM

Forget chicken n' waffles.  I'm eatin' Colombian style - Chicken n' Arepas!  Jacob J suggested this place, and the rotisserie here is definitely better than Pollo Feliz's chicken in Pilsen.   As far as the starches go (arepas, yuca, and baked potato), they were all pretty bland.  I had to order some rice with the dish.

I've been back here plenty times since my original review. Over the years had times to try their other offerings and here to tell you to stick to what you see, the chicken. I've had the appetizers which aren't a big deal and you might as well save the space for chicken. I've also had the steak and chicken breast, fish, etc.. It's all not comparable to that rotisserie chicken! Peep the photo's, it all looks great but the chicken, the chicken is best!  Again if you speak Spanish the service is that much better. Sadly they don't have a hot hot sauce of their own, they have Verde sauce which is just okay. Being the area that they are located it's easy to walk to a local store and get some hot sauce if you need it.  For more details see my older review.

The best chicken that I have had in a long time by far. The chicken is soooo juicy and flavorful its incredible. Their white rice and red beans goes great with it. I have dined in and taken to go. I would say its definitely more of a take out place. I've been  there many times, and every time I have it it never dissapoints.YUMMY!

MMM ate here a while ago and came late in the evening apparently around the time when they always run out of those hot chicks. Come here early is the moral. The whole chicken was slopped together with some soggy plantains and cornbread.  A little wierd because everything i ate had the same texture and flavor - i.e mushy and garlicky.   Maybe its so 90 year olds and babies could eat this stuff... and they do.. and they did when I was there.  Huge families were there slurping down this rotisserie mush.  Ah well, really  I'm not complaining really because I downed the whole meal in 5 minutes. I still crave it from time to time, but its so freakin far!

So, I dine in this restaurant 2 days in a row in an attempt to try their special roasted chicken.  First attempt, I went with Kevin C. and we were so excited based on all these yelp reviews.  Unbelievably, they didn't have enough chicken!!  We were seriously thinking of leaving.....how could a restaurant that specializes in roast chicken run out of it?  But we decided to stay and try something else.  We instead ordered their garlic chicken breast and that was pretty amazing.  Very very good.  It was grilled and definitely garlic-y with fried plantains (not the sweet kind) and potatoes all around it.  We also ordered the corn pancake with cheese and that was heavenly....put a dab of some of their mouth-watering green salsa on it and it's perfect.  The service could have been better though. Second attempt, I come in with the fiance a couple hours earlier than I did the previous day and lo and behold, I see rows of roasted chicken lined up....mission accomplished!  I ordered the delicious corn pancake again and the roasted chicken.  The roasted chicken was pretty big.  I think that it would be good enough for 3 adults because we had a good amount of leftovers.  They chop it up for you so it's not hard to get it yourself.  The chicken was very very good, even better with the green salsa.  It was very meaty and the skins were amazing!  The chicken also came with a sweet plantain and a corncake (minus the cheese).  The total for everything, including tax, was just under $14!

This place kinda ranks between 3 stars and 4 stars. Reason being, there were a couple of hits and misses during last night's monday night dinner. HIT: The corn (and cheese) pancake was indeed amazing. MISS: The portions were a little small (only 1 corncake and 1 plantain per order) HIT: The grilled chicken breast was delicious! MISS: They ran out of whole rotisserie chicken when we arrived at 8pm. HIT: Their entrees were priced fairly and were big enough to share. MISS: The service was a little ... absent. Kinda absent minded at times. But since this IS a restaurant, the food is really what matters. I'd come here again in a heartbeat, just with more realistic expectations when it comes to their service.

If it wasn't for my friend Yuly's review on this place, I would've paid no mind to ordering from here. I came here with my sister last month and we were floored by their reasonable pricing. 10 dollars for a whole chicken, two small fingerling potatoes, plantains, and corncakes! When you order the chicken, they take it out of the roaster, cut it to pieces and heat it back up on the charcoal grill. Then the place one huge plantain and a corncake in the container and lay the chicken pieces on top of it. They also give you a side of salsa verde (it's very addicting and has the right amount of heat to it).  Seriously, Tamia and her cousins were eating the chicken and rice up like there was no tomorrow. I mean they even asked for second! It beats going to jewel and being charged 6 bucks for their roasted chicken (small and the meat is always on the skimpy side). Also, Tamia and my sister thought their flan was pretty good. Overall, great chicken and very reasonably priced!

Remins me of Pio Pio in Queens, NY. Peruvian/columbian style wood charcoal grilled Chicken. Fantastic special, good portions and tasty food you can see them cut your pieces in front of you. IM GLAD I LIVE NEARBY!

for my hundredth review, i figured i should review something amazing... to directly quote my friend, coworker and fellow brasa roja lover, scott: "have you ever seen one of those shows with the morbidly obese guy who is so fat that he can't get out of bed? and he eats a dozen eggs, a pound of bacon and 3 chickens in a day?! i always wondered how someone could eat that much chicken... until i had brasa roja!" yeah... its that good. so good that i cannot do it justice with my own words. so i'll move onto another stolen quote about chicken: brasa roja must put an addictive chemical in their chicken that makes ya crave it fortnightly, cuz damn is that shit amazing! oh, and if the delicious, smokey, slow-cooked rotisserie chicken wasn't enough on its own, they throw in a fried plantain, potatoes, an arepa and this perfectly spicy, green salsa for TEN DOLLARS!  if this turns out to be my last review, its because i've quit my job, formed the church of brasa roja and am too busy creating a giant chicken shrine to write anymore.
Best Chicken I ever ate comes with two potates and a really sweet plantain. All for $10.

AMAZING CHICKEN. I've smelled this place before when they've had the door open in the summer, and it lived up to the aromas. DELICIOUS. I'm only giving this 4 stars because I'm all about healthy eating, and this place could be considered anything but....but damn it's delicious. I think I got all my weekly protein in one meal. UPDATE: I downgraded this from 4 stars to 2 due to severe indigestion I experienced about an hour after we left the restaurant. My in-laws and husband went there for lunch today while I was elsewhere, and I ate a small piece of leftover chicken when I got home. Alas, the indigestion came back. Sadly, I don't think I'll ever be back. :o(
Super service... not rushed and extremely friendly.  Yum chicken and Peruvian drinks. Nice presentation of appetizers.  Fair prices.  Kid friendly.

I think this place is Columbian? Either way it's really good food and pretty inexpensive. It's definately a casual destination, the tables are more like cafeteria style but the food is so tasty. They have all the standard fair, chicken, steak, rice, yuca, beans etc. I used to go here for breakfast and not need to eat for the rest of the day.

Once you eat this fire roasted chicken you will suddenly realize that there is such a thing as heaven on a plate.  PERFECTION.  You haven't tasted chicken until you've eaten it here.  Yeah it's that good.

Great garlic chicken and cassava, very fast. Would have given them 4 stars except for 2 things:  #1 sometimes when I call for carry-out, the person on the phone can't understand my order (no English) so I'll say "hold on" and put on my husband who knows Spanish. He will start to order in Spanish and after about two words, the order-taker miraculously remembers that they *do* in fact understand English.  WTF?  #2 we always pay with credit card and twice now the charge that shows up on our bill is $5 or so more than the actual tab. giving themselves a little extra tip? I called and complained to the owner who admitted that this does happen every once in a while. uh, not ok. pay with cash only!

When I first arrived at this place I was very skeptical since it looked like a Burrito joint from the outside. As we walked in, there was not much of an ambiance but there were lots of people appearing to be satisfied eating their food. One of the waiters then proceeded to seat us and gave us the spanish menu and since I am not proficient, I had to go with the pictures and thank god it worked, it lead me to order the steak and combo menu and it was nothing short of spectacular, very well seasoned and hefty portions. I even had enough to take home. They also had these refreshing frozen drinks that is very similar to a bubble tea. I tried the Passion fruit and my friend tried the soursop and it hit the spot. I would definitely go back here again.  We went here on a very cold November day and it felt like the restaurant did not have their heat on so we had to eat with our coats on to prevent from shivering. However, eating the tasty chicken and empanadas warmed us up a bit. The other downside to this place is the parking situation. It is located on a fairly busy street so parking is a bit hard to find on a weekend night.

Ok you are delicious, and you know it. This place is a great go to for some yummy chicken and pork lion,ROAR(special points for the menu typos) I will say I get really weird looks everytime I stand and wait for my food.  Maybe its cuz I'm always in my pj's.  Anywhoo, the problem is mostly with the waiters and not the front person.  My take is to order to go, and get my chicken w/salsa on!

Ok so haven't ate chicken like this in a looong while.  Use to go to Mr. Pollo but just never found my way back there.  I was so eager to eat that I just walked in and ordered right off the menu with sides & ended up paying $12 for rice, beans, 1/2 chicken, and plantains. Didn't think it was da best deal, but not bad. So I'm walking out the door & it turns out plastered right on the window was a 1/4 chicken special for $5!!! Yeah I felt a lil dumb but I was hungry & just wanted to get my food & go, but man it was worth da $12.  Very good so I will def be making my way bck here.

For $10, you get a whole chicken and several sides.   The restaurant is pretty bare bones but I'm not really going there for the ambiance.  I'm looking for some tasty chicken and they definitely have that.  I don't know what combination of spices they use, but the chicken has tons of flavor and isn't dry.   One of the interesting things about this place is the girl manning the rotisserie occasionally drags the bag of real charcoals (not the stuff most of us use in our Webers) and will throw them into the oven.  I guess that's how they get their name.
Heavenly rotissierie chicken for take out or dine in. Addictive!

we were had just dropped our car off at the mechanic's when were were looking for a place to eat, so we stopped in... when it comes down to it, this place is a quaint family own'd restaurant with good affordable columbian food... when you first walk in the first that catches your eye is the giant whole chicken roaster... the decor is a little dirty what with all that smoke/grease residue our waiter was very nice and checked up on us periodically, we would definitely eat there again

I would say that we caught La Brasa Rojo off guard if we hadn't called at 2pm for reservations for 14 people at 7:30.  Pretty much everyone wanted to try the "hits" from the rave reviews here on Yelp.  We went in there with rot. chicken and cheesy pancakes on our minds.  Well, guess what.  There were only 3 chickens left (had probably been there for hours) and they were completely out of the cheesy pancakes.  Man that sucks.  Luckily I managed to get a half of one of the chickens. The food: Wonderful.  I'm a self- proclaimed rotisserie chicken connoisseur and this place has some of the best I have ever had.  Mine had been sitting out for awhile...but it was still great.  The food-to-price ratio here is fantastic!   The service/atmostphere: HOT!  If it is above 80 degrees outside you had better wear shorts to this place or you're likely to pass out.  This is probably not a place you want to take a large group to dinner.  We had some issues in the beginning getting the waitress's attention.  So much so that we just helped ourselves to the glassware.  I did raise my brow at the "plate" the chicken breast was served on.  It was a wooden plank that looked like it was pulled from the bottom of a river.  Whatever...if the food's good enough I'll eat it off the floor.   Overall I would say that I can see myself stopping into this place once a month or so to take home a bird.  I probably won't make it a destination for another sit down meal...but you can bet you'll see me playing Frogger trying to cross Montrose with a big 'ol bag of juicy chicken.

Do you know how hard it is to live a few blocks away from this place and NOT order  it on a daily basis?   This place is AMAZING!  Well, the restaurant isn't, but the food is KILLER!  We've nicknamed it "the crack-chicken place".  Why?  Because they MUST put something addictive in it (i.e. crack) in order to make you crave it every day!  I have family that comes in from out of town and request it even before they get here!   It is, hands down, the best  chicken I've EVER had!   As others have posted, you may want to learn a little bit of Spanish or bring someone who can translate for you!  Most of the employees don't speak English all that well, but trust me, it'll be a complete non issue for you once you've tasted the chicken!

all the other reviews give great advice for ordering, as I wouldn't have known what to get other than chicken, and the corn pancakes with cheese and fried plantains are super tasty.  the place has some of the best chicken I've ever had.  my only criticism is it was way hot inside the restaurant.  I was getting carry-out, so I just stood outside, but inside was a furnace.  Don't know if it is always like this.

We had their speciality -- the whole roasted Chicken.  It was certainly tasty, and came with sides of potatoes, potato cake, and plantain.  It's still BYOB.  They have other BBQ roasted meats available, but would prefer to eat at their sister restaurant El Llano for that (see my review of El Llano).  Only criticism is that if you eat in as we did, the pre-cut chicken pieces tend to be a little overdone (and perhaps a little dry) because they re-heat them in the BBQ before serving.  Probably better to take out the whole Roasted Chicken.

Since my life has just become checking things out that I find on  yelp.com  I decided to pick up carryout from La Brasa Roja tonight.  If I just say PERFECT is that enough? This was the best chicken I have ever had. I have driven past La Brasa Roja prob 500 times in the last month and have never even noticed it!  What is on that chicken? Do they bottle it?  I bought the full chicken meal, when I brought it home I got a quick "oh, I am not into Columbian Food, what else did you get" from hubby. Then he tasted it and wanted to go back to pick up another!

All I can say is WOW. This HAS to be the best chicken in Chicago! The place is one of the places you would just pass up walking by, but once inside and tasting the chicken you will be hooked. They are wooden charcoal cooked and are fresh. And yes the chicken is dirt cheap for the taste. They also have other items like beef ribs, but once inside there is just one thing you will want. If you are looking for a place I definitely recommend La Brasa Roja!

"So What'cha, What'cha, What'cha Want?" If I had to guess, I'd say Mike D, Adrock and MCA rolled a fat one and rapped their asses over to La Brasa Roja to indulge in some chicken before they scratched down the lyrics to Finger Lickin' Good.  The birds at LBR are marinated in some crazy Colombian nectar-of-the-Gods and slow-roasted to perfection.  My mom said, "What do you think they marinate this delicious chicken in and do you think they would give me the recipe?"  I said, "Mom, there ain't nuthin' in the world that could make chicken taste so good--it's heavenly!  And, I think they would have to kill you if they told you the secret to their success!"   Despite what a lot of foodies think, you don't have to pay and arm & a leg, or sell your one-of-a-kind Mickey Mantle card, nor do you have to promise your first born, to enjoy a fecking delicious meal here in Chick-a-go.  The proof is in the pudding, kids. Or, in this case, el pollo.  Sure, this place is the size of a NYC studio, and yeah, the cold air takes y'er breath away when someone opens the door,  but you can get a 1/2 chicken dinner with all the sides for like $4.95.   In fact, I think I heard Bob Barker yell out from the kitchen, "Let's make a deal!"    If you want some traditional food, ask for el calentado con los heuvos y el carne...or los patacones (fried green plantain cakes) or las empanadas and jugo de lulo con leche (a Colombian fruit made into a juice blended with milk).  The only thing I was kind of disappointed about were the arepas (Colombian corn cakes and the Colombian version of the Mexican tortilla); I have eaten better hockey pucks with more flavor.  Spanish 101: La Brasa Roja means The Red Coal and is quite apropos when you see how the succulant chicken is prepared.

We love this place. My husband is Colombian, so when we moved around the corner from this little place, of course we had to try it. It was great. The chicken is the most popular, and when you walk in, you will immediately know why. You can't help but smell it. We just took 10 people and spent only $102 (including the tip) and most went home with left overs. The Arepas (corn pancakes) were better than anywhere else we have had them, but you have to get the ones with queso (cheese) or they are bland. The Empenadas (meat and potato filled turnovers)  were just like Tia (auntie) makes in her kitchen. And the sauce is great. Put it on the Empanada/Arepa and it brings out the flavors. Carry out is usually only 10-15 minutes, and dine in is about the same. Service is great! Being Colombian helps with this though since we didn't have any trouble communicating with the staff. If you want to be brave and try some Colombian beverages try the Colombiana (Champagne Cola). My husband loves the Pony Malta, I HATE IT!   I would recommend for first timers bringing a friend and sharing a whole chicken, and getting 2 empanadas, 1 arepa co queso (the appetizer not the one that comes with the meal - it is different) to share (they are very filling and expand in your stomach), and 2 Colombiana. 07/02/07 I have been reading other's reviews and since we live around the corner and love the place, I would say If you were disappointented with the Arepa, it was probably because it was the one that came with the meal. It is just Mas Arepa Flower and water then heated. The Appetizer that you order is actually Arepa con Queso, and is so much better and has so much more flavor. Consider trying this one next time you go and don't even bother with the other one unless you just like them. I bring them to my mother-in-law and she eats them with her coffee the next morning, which she says is what she used to do when she was younger in Colombia with her mother.  Also they do accept credit cards, and there is not minimum. We use our debit card all the time for a to go order of under $10.

you can smell the rotisserie at this little colombian spot way down the block, and it draws you in. great roasted chicken, and tasty steaks served with big portions of rice, beans & salad. get a side of corn pancakes with your meal, they're delicious.
